Page Contents

    Implementing Dynamic Delivery Rules

    In this topic, you will learn how to implement Dynamic Delivery Rules, which enable you to customize how your media is delivered to meet your business objectives.

    Overview

    Publishers often need to modify the content characteristics of their media manifests for both technical and business reasons.

    To meet these needs, Brightcove has created a framework where rules can be applied that will modify the contents of the manifest returned from Dynamic Delivery. Behaviors are defined as "if" conditions that will trigger a certain rule and a series of "then" parameters that will define how the manifest is modified.

    If you are not familiar with this feature, see the Overview: Dynamic Delivery Rules document.

    Applying rules

    The following flow diagrams show how delivery rules are applied.

    Behaviors

    The behaviors, or "if" conditions, supported in the first phase include the following:

    • Explicit Request - A configuration ID that you can pass to the Playback API at runtime. This ID is mapped to configuration values that allow underlying services to make decisions leveraged by the Playback API to return the appropriate response data.

    • Device Group - Device type as detected by user-agent parsing. The groups currently supported include:
      • android
      • appletv
      • ipad
      • iphone
      • desktop-chrome
      • desktop-firefox
      • desktop-safari
      • fetchtv
      • ios-other
      • roku-7/8
      • smartphone-generic
      • tablet-android
      • tablet-kindle
      • unknown
       
    • Geography - Physical location of the requesting device:
      • Continent
      • Country

    Rules

    The rules, or "then" parameters, supported in the first phase include the following:

    • Media Delivery CDN - From the CDNs configured for use within a given Dynamic Delivery account, the CDN to use for delivery of media segments.

    • Rendition Characteristics - Filters based on characteristics of the underlying media renditions. These include:
      • Minimum video bitrate
      • Maximum video bitrate
      • Minimum video resolution
      • Maximum video resolution
      • Maximum number of audio renditions
      • Maximum number of video renditions
      • First video bitrate
      • Discontinuities

    Scope

    Rules can be applied at two levels:

    • Account - Rules that apply to all requests made to a specific customer's account
    • Request Specific - Rules that are invoked on a specific request

    Rules will be applied in the order listed above. Later rules will override earlier ones.

    Enabling the feature

    During the initial phase of Delivery Rules, all rules will be configured by Brightcove. Contact your account manager to learn about pricing and enable this feature for your account.

    Limitations

    There are a few known limitations when using Delivery Rules:

    • Media Content - Delivery Rules will not work with Smooth or pMP4 videos.
    • Audio Only - Delivery Rules with Server-Side Ads (SSAI) enabled require both video and audio content. This is an SSAI restriction.

    Related topics

    • Overview: Dynamic Delivery Rules
    • Using Dynamic Delivery Rules with Brightcove Player
    • Using Dynamic Delivery Rules with the Native SDKs
